title: Penghargaan Soebroto 2025, Dirut Pertamina Apresiasi Pejuang Energi Wujudkan Inovasi ...
description:
Direktur Utama PT Pertamina (Persero) Simon Aloysius Mantiri memberikan apresiasi kepada Perwira Pertamina atas perjuangannya membangun ketahanan energi di Tanah Air.
Kegigihan Perwira dalam berinovasi mengantarkan Pertamina untuk meraih 11 penghargaan dalam ajang Penghargaan Soebroto ke-8 tahun 2025.
"Saya mewakili jajaran direksi mengapresiasi sumbangsih seluruh Perwira Pertamina, yang telah memberi kontribusi terbaiknya pada industri energi di Indonesia.
Pertamina juga berterima kasih kepada Kementerian ESDM, atas penghargaannya yang diberikan pada Pertamina," terang Simon di sela acara Penganugerahan Penghargaan Soebroto di Jakarta, Jumat (24/10/2025).
"Sejalan dengan arahan Menteri ESDM, Pertamina berkomitmen untuk bersinergi dengan berbagai pihak sehingga mampu mendukung tercapainya ketahanan energi sebagaimana diamanahkan Presiden Prabowo Subianto," jelas Simon.
text:
Direktur Utama PT Pertamina (Persero) Simon Aloysius Mantiri memberikan apresiasi kepada Perwira Pertamina atas perjuangannya membangun ketahanan energi di Tanah Air. Kegigihan Perwira dalam berinovasi mengantarkan Pertamina untuk meraih 11 penghargaan dalam ajang Penghargaan Soebroto ke-8 tahun 2025.

Penghargaa Soebroto merupakan bentuk apresiasi tertinggi dari Kementerian ESDM kepada badan usaha dan lembaga yang berkontribusi signifikan terhadap kemajuan sektor energi dan sumber daya mineral nasional.

"Saya mewakili jajaran direksi mengapresiasi sumbangsih seluruh Perwira Pertamina, yang telah memberi kontribusi terbaiknya pada industri energi di Indonesia. Pertamina juga berterima kasih kepada Kementerian ESDM, atas penghargaannya yang diberikan pada Pertamina," terang Simon di sela acara Penganugerahan Penghargaan Soebroto di Jakarta, Jumat (24/10/2025).

Pertamina mendukung kebijakan Kementerian ESDM yang berperan penting dalam mewujudkan visi Asta Cita terkait ketahanan energi nasional. Melalui upaya kolaborasi dan inovasi yang masif, hal ini diyakini akan dapat mempercepat tercapainya target pemerintah, Indonesia Emas 2045.

"Sejalan dengan arahan Menteri ESDM, Pertamina berkomitmen untuk bersinergi dengan berbagai pihak sehingga mampu mendukung tercapainya ketahanan energi sebagaimana diamanahkan Presiden Prabowo Subianto," jelas Simon.

Pada ajang Penghargaan Soebroto juga dilakukan peluncuran logo baru Kementerian ESDM. Logo baru tersebut mengusung filosofi Pancar Dipa, melambangkan energi yang menyinari setiap aspek kehidupan dan memberikan manfaat bagi Indonesia, serta menciptakan inovasi dalam memandu masa depan sumber daya mineral dan energi Indonesia.

"Kami mengucapkan selamat atas logo baru Kementerian ESDM, yang menandai semangat baru untuk mencapai target ketahanan energi dan kesejahteraan bangsa," tambah Simon.

title: HUT Ke-80 ESDM, Pertamina Siap Kolaborasi Wujudkan Target Ketahanan Energi Nasional
description:
PT Pertamina (Persero) siap mendukung Pemerintah dalam mencapai Asta Cita mewujudkan ketahanan energi, melalui upaya dan inovasi untuk meningkatkan produksi migas, sekaligus pengembangan energi baru dan terbarukan (EBT).
Direktur Utama Pertamina Simon Aloysius Mantiri menegaskan, kesiapan Pertamina melakukan kolaborasi dengan berbagai pihak guna mewujudkan ketahanan energi nasional.
”Sesuai visi perusahaan untuk menjadi perusahaan energi yang mengedepankan ketahanan, ketersediaan, dan keberlanjutan, Pertamina siap mendukung Asta Cita Presiden Prabowo Subianto.
Pertamina juga mendukung kolaborasi dengan berbagai pihak untuk mewujudkan ketahanan energi,” jelas Simon.
Sebagaimana pesan Menteri ESDM, imbuh Simon, Pertamina akan terus berupaya meningkatkan lifting migas dan mempercepat implementasi program transisi energi dengan memanfaatkan EBT.
text:
PT Pertamina (Persero) siap mendukung Pemerintah dalam mencapai Asta Cita mewujudkan ketahanan energi, melalui upaya dan inovasi untuk meningkatkan produksi migas, sekaligus pengembangan energi baru dan terbarukan (EBT).

Hal tersebut sejalan dengan pesan-pesan Menteri ESDM Bahlil Lahadila pada HUT ke-80 Kementerian ESDM, saat menyampaikan beberapa capaian di sektor energi antara lain lifting migas yang melampaui target APBN serta percepatan implementasi program transisi energi dengan memanfaatkan EBT melalui bahan bakar nabati.

"Masih banyak hal yang harus kita tingkatkan. Target kita apa yang diperintahkan oleh Bapak Presiden pada 2029–2030 harus mencapai 900.000 sampai 1.000.000 barrel per day agar kita bisa mengurangi impor," kata Menteri ESDM saat menyampaikan sambutannya di acara HUT ke-80s Kementerian ESDM di Monas, Jakarta, Jumat (24/10/2025).

Direktur Utama Pertamina Simon Aloysius Mantiri menegaskan, kesiapan Pertamina melakukan kolaborasi dengan berbagai pihak guna mewujudkan ketahanan energi nasional.

”Sesuai visi perusahaan untuk menjadi perusahaan energi yang mengedepankan ketahanan, ketersediaan, dan keberlanjutan, Pertamina siap mendukung Asta Cita Presiden Prabowo Subianto. Pertamina juga mendukung kolaborasi dengan berbagai pihak untuk mewujudkan ketahanan energi,” jelas Simon.

Sebagaimana pesan Menteri ESDM, imbuh Simon, Pertamina akan terus berupaya meningkatkan lifting migas dan mempercepat implementasi program transisi energi dengan memanfaatkan EBT.

title: Airbus H160 makes Australian debut - Asian Aviation
description:
An Airbus H160 has landed in Melbourne, kickstarting a month-long demonstration tour across Australia.
“The H160 represents the future of flight, combining advanced technology, mission versatility and reduced environmental impact in one sleek platform,” said Olivier Michalon, Executive Vice President, Global Business, Airbus Helicopters.
Equipped with the Helionix avionics suite, the H160 offers intuitive flight controls, enhanced situational awareness and reduced pilot workload.
With a reduced maintenance footprint and streamlined support architecture, the aircraft delivers exceptional availability and cost-efficiency for operators across sectors.
Airbus Helicopters maintains a robust footprint in Australia, supporting over 360 helicopters in operation across the country.
text:
An Airbus H160 has landed in Melbourne, kickstarting a month-long demonstration tour across Australia. The next-generation helicopter will visit key cities and coastal communities to showcase how it supports a wide range of missions, from saving lives to homeland security, natural disaster management, and transporting offshore crew, while setting new standards in safety, performance and sustainability.

“The H160 represents the future of flight, combining advanced technology, mission versatility and reduced environmental impact in one sleek platform,” said Olivier Michalon, Executive Vice President, Global Business, Airbus Helicopters. “The H160 is the most cost efficient in its class. We’re thrilled to bring the helicopter to Australia and demonstrate how it can elevate operations across this region.”

The H160 is one of the world’s most technologically advanced helicopters, designed and built to deliver the highest levels of operational safety while providing unmatched comfort for rotorcraft in its class. Equipped with the Helionix avionics suite, the H160 offers intuitive flight controls, enhanced situational awareness and reduced pilot workload.

Beyond cabin ergonomics, the H160’s design reduces environmental and community impact while boosting mission performance. Its innovative Blue Edge main rotor blades and canted Fenestron tail rotor cut perceived sound by up to 50% compared to conventional designs.

Optimised with Safran Arrano engines, the H160 delivers 18% reduction in fuel burn. It is also certified to fly with a 50% blend of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). With a reduced maintenance footprint and streamlined support architecture, the aircraft delivers exceptional availability and cost-efficiency for operators across sectors.

Designed to meet the demands of diverse and high-stakes missions, the H160 excels in environments where reliability and adaptability are paramount Its expansive cabin, unobstructed visibility, and swift reconfiguration capabilities position it as a standout choice for multi-role operations.

The H160 has entered into service in Brazil, Canada, China, France, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Philippines, Saudi Arabia, U.K., U.S. and many other European countries.

Airbus Helicopters maintains a robust footprint in Australia, supporting over 360 helicopters in operation across the country. Most recently, the company expanded its locally embedded support network with the opening of a new parts distribution centre near Perth Airport, enabling faster, more responsive service to operators across the region.

title: AAV News in Brief 26 October 2025 - Asian Aviation
description:
Under this renewed agreement, Aviation Concepts will continue serving as an authorised distributor for BAE Systems’ aerospace products within the defined territory.
We must protect them, not penalise them.” CPaT Global partners with Avia Solutions Group: CPaT Global announced they have been awarded a new contract with Avia Solutions Group, the world’s largest ACMI provider.
“Partnering with Avia Solutions Group reflects CPaT’s commitment to supporting aviation leaders with scalable and effective training solutions,” said Capt.
Neste began the SAF deliveries to United at George Bush Airport in July and they will continue until the end of October 2025.
Deliveries of SAF to Newark Airport and Dulles Airport started in September 2025 and are set to continue until the end of 2025.
text:
BAE Systems, Aviation Concepts renew distribution deal: Aviation Concepts announced the renewal of its International Distributor Agreement with BAE Systems. Under this renewed agreement, Aviation Concepts will continue serving as an authorised distributor for BAE Systems’ aerospace products within the defined territory. This collaboration strengthens Aviation Concepts’ portfolio and expands access to BAE Systems’ trusted technologies and solutions for operators around the world. Through the collaboration, Aviation Concepts will leverage its proven customer support capabilities and global industry relationships to provide enhanced availability of BAE Systems’ products. The agreement builds on Aviation Concepts’ reputation as a trusted partner to commercial, regional, and corporate aviation customers worldwide. “BAE Systems is pleased to renew this distribution agreement, which represents a significant step in expanding market reach and strengthening our joint effort for long- term success,” said Tim Wells, director of asset management and new business programs at BAE Systems.

Air Astana expands fleet: Air Astana took delivery of a new Airbus A321neo from the manufacturer’s facility in Hamburg, Germany on 17 October 2025. This is the sixth aircraft of this type to join the Air Astana Group fleet. Air Astana’s fleet now comprises of 62 modern Airbus and Boeing aircraft, contributing to enhanced operational efficiency and reliability. Despite ongoing challenges in the aviation industry, the airline continues with the steady renewal of its fleet as part of a sustainable growth strategy. The Air Astana Group plans to increase the fleet to 84 aircraft by 2029.

Satair and Mercury Products sign global distribution deal: Satair and Airchair have signed a new five-year global distribution agreement covering Airchair I and Airchair II. This marks the first collaboration between the two companies and reflects their shared commitment to improving the passenger experience for travellers with reduced mobility. Airchair I has been in operation with airlines since 2007; Airchair II has been developed to fully comply with the latest US Department of Transportation (DOT) regulations on accessibility. Compact, lightweight and easy to handle, the Airchair enables passengers with reduced mobility to access aircraft lavatories in greater comfort and dignity during flight. By working together, Satair and Airchair are helping airlines worldwide meet evolving accessibility standards while providing a meaningful improvement to the travel experience of passengers with reduced mobility.

AerFin completes A320neo teardown, places engines: AerFin announced the successful completion of a 2017-vintage Airbus A320neo disassembly carried out by SIA Engineering Company (SIAEC) at its facility in the Philippines, SIAEP. The project marks a series of industry firsts for the region. Not only is this the first teardown of an A320neo in the Philippines, it is also SIAEP’s first-ever aircraft teardown. Completed nose-to-tail in just 30 days, the disassembly will make high-quality used serviceable parts from the world’s most in-demand narrowbody platform readily available to operators and MROs across Asia-Pacific. The aircraft, powered by PW1100 engines, forms part of AerFin’s growing pipeline of A320neo acquisitions. By partnering with SIAEP to complete the teardown within the region, AerFin is reducing lead times and strengthening supply chains to help customers access serviceable engines and components where and when they need them. AerFin also announced it has successfully placed two PW1100 engines removed from its fifth Airbus A320neo aircraft acquisition. The engines, purchased from EMP Aviation as part of AerFin’s ongoing partnership with a Middle Eastern investor, were removed in the Philippines by SIAEP (Singapore Airlines Engineering Philippines) and subsequently housed in Singapore by B&H Worldwide prior to their placement.

Plaza Premium Group unveils lounges at Techo International Airport: Plaza Premium Group (PPG) announced the opening of Plaza Premium First (PPF) and Plaza Premium Lounge (PPL) at the newly launched Techo International Airport (KTI) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. This milestone marks the Group’s continued commitment to redefining airport hospitality worldwide while reinforcing its presence in Southeast Asia. Designed by Foster + Partners, the new airport supports Cambodia’s green energy and sustainable development goals, as it combines modern infrastructure with eco-friendly technologies and energy-efficient design. The opening of Plaza Premium Group’s two new airport lounges in Phnom Penh marks a significant step in the company’s ongoing expansion in Southeast Asia, further strengthening its award-winning hospitality presence and redefining the benchmarks of comfort and cultural immersion for international travellers. As the world’s leading independent airport lounge operator, PPG unites distinctive luxury and an authentic sense of place through its dual brands—Plaza Premium First and Plaza Premium Lounge—both crafted to enhance every moment of the travel experience.

Flydubai announces new interline agreements: Flydubai, the Dubai-based carrier, has announced seven new interline agreements, bringing the carrier’s total number of interline partners to more than 40. These strategic agreements give flydubai customers access to more than 30 destinations in Europe through Greece’s flagship carrier, Aegean Airlines, and Italy’s national carrier, ITA Airways. In addition, flydubai passengers travelling to the Far East and South-East Asia can enjoy greater connectivity to more than 90 destinations with Myanmar Airways International and Chinese airlines Air China, China Eastern Airlines, Hainan Airlines and Sichuan Airlines. Through these new partnerships, passengers can benefit from a seamless travel experience with single-ticket itineraries and through-checked baggage, reflecting the carrier’s commitment to expanding connectivity and opening up new destinations. Today, flydubai has built a growing network of more than 135 destinations, enabling access to more than 300 destinations through its interline and codeshare partners.

Virgin Atlantic renews Osprey Flight Solutions partnership: Virgin Atlantic has renewed its partnership with Osprey Flight Solutions, extending its five-year relationship for a further three years to support safe, efficient and effective global operations. As airlines face evolving operational pressures, from regulatory complexity to shifting geopolitical tensions, intelligence has become an essential tool for maintaining business continuity and mitigating risks. Virgin Atlantic’s daily security process includes the use of Osprey’s platform, enabling its teams to assess risks quickly, adapt flight planning in real time and avoid disruption. Nigel Williams, Global Head of Security, Virgin Atlantic, says: “The growing geopolitical instability has made Osprey’s aviation risk platform a must have for us. As an airline, we have a responsibility to our passengers in ensuring they are protected during their journey. The unrivalled insight Osprey delivers is absolutely vital for running our business securely, giving us the confidence to make timely, informed decisions that keep our operations running smoothly.”

Elysian Aircraft and TrueNoord partner on electric aviation: Elysian and TrueNoord announced the signing a collaboration agreement during European Regions Airline Association (ERA) General Assembly in Estoril, to bring together aircraft innovation and leasing expertise in support of the E9X, Elysian’s flagship programme for emission-free short-haul aviation. The partnership will be based around a series of strategic sessions addressing critical topics for financing and leasing such as direct operating costs, residual value and after-sales support for the E9X aircraft. These sessions confirm the interest of TrueNoord to investigate these aircraft and will provide a platform for open dialogue between innovators, financiers, airlines and other stakeholders across the sustainable aviation ecosystem. Anne-Bart Tieleman, CEO of TrueNoord, added: “We are delighted to welcome Elysian to the TrueNoord New Technology Hub. We strongly believe that lessors including TrueNoord are an integral part of the future technology aircraft ecosystem by enabling the provision of optimised leasing solutions for our lessees. This will generate the revenue needed for the new generation of OEMs, including Elysian, to both thrive and reward their investors for the risk they take to develop the new aircraft. The purpose of the TrueNoord New Technology Hub is to ensure that the economics of such aircraft are sufficiently attractive for our customers to make that step.”

ATR Calls on EU to protect regional airlines: As Europe faces the dual challenge of reducing emissions while preserving the mobility of its communities and businesses, ATR urges EU policymakers to adopt a proportionate, inclusive, and performance-based approach to regulation – one that reflects the realities of regional operators and supports their vital role in Europe’s mobility network. Regional airlines are the backbone of European connectivity. They serve communities that larger carriers won’t reach, fly where rail won’t go, where ferries are seasonal, and where roads are impractical. They connect students to universities, patients to hospitals, and families to each other. Yet, despite their efficiency and essential role, regional operators are facing increasing regulatory pressure. The ongoing implementation of the Fit for 55 package risks undermining the very operators who are already doing the most with the least. “Regional airlines are more than just carriers, they’re lifelines,” says Nathalie Tarnaud Laude, Chief Executive Officer of ATR. “They serve the most essential routes and are already leading the way in low-emission aviation. We must protect them, not penalise them.”

CPaT Global partners with Avia Solutions Group: CPaT Global announced they have been awarded a new contract with Avia Solutions Group, the world’s largest ACMI provider. Through this agreement, CPaT will deliver Aircraft Systems, General Subjects, and Safety Courses for Cabin Crew training across Avia Solutions Group’s 12 Air Operator Certificates (AOCs). The partnership will strengthen standardisation and elevate training quality throughout the Group, ensuring consistent, high-quality instruction across all operations. “Partnering with Avia Solutions Group reflects CPaT’s commitment to supporting aviation leaders with scalable and effective training solutions,” said Capt. Greg Darrow, Vice President of Sales. “This agreement provides a strong foundation for standardized training across a global organisation with extensive operational reach.” Avia Solutions Group is based in Ireland, Dublin, and provides aviation services spanning six continents.

Avolon signs sale-leaseback with TAAG Angola Airlines: Avolon, a leading global aviation finance company, announces the agreement of a sale and leaseback for one new Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft to TAAG Angola Airlines (‘TAAG’), the national carrier of Angola. This is Avolon’s first aircraft on lease to TAAG and it was delivered at the end of September. Powered by General Electric GEnx engines, the aircraft has a range of over 7,500 nautical miles. It will support the expansion of TAAG’s long-haul connectivity, with the airline’s fleet of 18 aircraft already flying to multiple destinations across Africa, Europe, Asia, and the Americas. Paul Geaney, President and Chief Commercial Officer of Avolon, said: “We are proud to welcome TAAG Angola Airlines as a new customer and support the growth of their widebody fleet. Africa is expected to be one of the fastest growing regions for aviation over the next twenty years, driven by the rising demand for travel and growing economies. As Angola’s flag carrier, TAAG will play an important role in expanding the route network across the region. We look forward building on our relationship and supporting their continued growth.”

Neste expands SAF deal with United: Neste and United Airlines have expanded their existing partnership to supply sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) to three new major airports in the United States. The new agreement makes United the first commercial airline to purchase SAF for use on flights from George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH) in Houston, Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR) in New Jersey, and Dulles International Airport (IAD) in Washington D.C. As part of the agreement, Neste will supply neat Neste MY Sustainable Aviation Fuel™ to United Airlines. The sustainable aviation fuel will be blended with conventional jet fuel before use to meet jet fuel specifications. Neste began the SAF deliveries to United at George Bush Airport in July and they will continue until the end of October 2025. Deliveries of SAF to Newark Airport and Dulles Airport started in September 2025 and are set to continue until the end of 2025. The fuel is delivered to each airport via existing pipeline infrastructure from Neste’s SAF terminal facilities in Houston. This new agreement builds on the long-term partnership between Neste and United. Neste has been supplying SAF to United at Chicago O’Hare International Airport since August 2024, after the SAF purchase credit was enacted in Illinois, making United the first airline to use SAF at the airport. Neste MY Sustainable Aviation Fuel has also been used by the airline at San Francisco International Airport in California, where the state’s Low Carbon Fuel Standard (LCFS) is supporting the use of renewable fuels.

Embraer celebrates Fort Worth MRO groundbreaking: Embraer held a groundbreaking ceremony recently to mark the start of construction on its new Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) facility for commercial jets at Perot Field Alliance Airport in Fort Worth. The event brought together local officials, Embraer executives, and representatives from partner organisations. This new, state-of-the-art hangar is scheduled for opening by 2027. With the expanded infrastructure, Embraer’s capacity to serve E-Jets customers in the United States will grow by 53%. The investment – expected to reach up to $70 million – is expected to create approximately 250 new skilled aviation jobs in Texas. In collaboration with the City of Fort Worth, Denton County, and the State of Texas, Embraer began operations at Alliance Airport in June at an existing hangar. “We are honoured to be here in Fort Worth, Texas – a city that represents innovation, resilience, and opportunity – to celebrate the groundbreaking of our new Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul facility at Perot Field Alliance Airport. This moment marks a new chapter in Embraer’s journey in the United States, a country where we’ve been for over 46 years. With an investment of up to $70 million and the creation of 250 new skilled aviation jobs, this facility is a symbol of our long-term commitment to the U.S. market,” said Francisco Gomes Neto, President and CEO of Embraer. The new Fort Worth service center will be part of Embraer’s global network, which includes more than 80 Authorised Service Centres and 13 Embraer Owned Service Centres worldwide.

title: How to halve aviation's global-warming impact | Workers' Liberty
description:
Those contrails have a cooling effect when sunlight reflects off them, but a warming effect when radiation reflected back from the earth's surface bounces back from them.
Generally the warming effect exceeds the cooling effect.
In any one year the warming effect from that year's contrails is almost as big as the warming effect from all the CO2 emitted from aviation (since it began) and remaining in the upper atmosphere.
The warming effect from old CO2 emissions will abate only slowly whatever we do now, and cutting new CO2 emissions from aviation is difficult without cutting aviation: Sustainable Aviation Fuel is, for now anyway, only a token gesture.
Three per cent of flights generate 80% of the warming effect from contrails, and three-quarters of flights generate no warming (or even some cooling).
text:
Discussion of this and other aspects of aviation and environment at the Workers' Ecology Reading Group Sunday, 26 October 2025 ⋅20:00 – 22:00 • Zoomlink bit.ly/eco-rg • Eventbrite

A recent article by Hannah Ritchie on "Sustainability by Numbers" tells us that nearly half the current global-warming impact of aviation comes not from its CO2 emissions but from "contrails" - "condensation trails", wispy clouds formed by water droplets condensing round particles emitted from the back of jet engines. To cut that half is technically easy, but blocked by airline bosses' greed for extra profit.

Those contrails have a cooling effect when sunlight reflects off them, but a warming effect when radiation reflected back from the earth's surface bounces back from them. Generally the warming effect exceeds the cooling effect.

In any one year the warming effect from that year's contrails is almost as big as the warming effect from all the CO2 emitted from aviation (since it began) and remaining in the upper atmosphere.

The warming effect from old CO2 emissions will abate only slowly whatever we do now, and cutting new CO2 emissions from aviation is difficult without cutting aviation: Sustainable Aviation Fuel is, for now anyway, only a token gesture.

But contrails are formed only in particular conditions, mostly in colder and more humid parts of the atmosphere. Three per cent of flights generate 80% of the warming effect from contrails, and three-quarters of flights generate no warming (or even some cooling).

So, says Ritchie, the contrail warming can be largely abolished by re-routing a minority of flights for small parts of their journeys to avoid the areas where warming-contrails form. We have the technology to do that.

Ritchie offers calculations to show that the extra flight time, and extra cost per passenger, would be small - a few minutes, a few pounds.

But it is hassle for the airline bosses. So they don't do it. Ritchie comments: "the United States could have led this effort domestically, mandating that internal flights eliminate their contrails...

"The European Union... has already been making some progress... Earlier this year, its trading system regulations were updated to require airlines to monitor and report non-CO2 impacts... Unsurprisingly, it has received pushback from the aviation industry, with them asking for these reports to be voluntary".

The aviation unions, and the labour movement, could win this one.

title: Minister inaugurates renovated Terminal-2 at Delhi airport - The Tribune
description:
The Terminal-2 at Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) is all set to become operation from Sunday after Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu on Saturday inaugurated the renovated terminal.
It has an annual capacity of 15 million passengers.
The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) in the Capital, also the country’s largest airport, has three terminals (T1, T2 and T3) and four runways.
Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL) operates IGIA.
On March 20, DIAL said the expanded T1 could accommodate 40 million passengers, and T3 could handle 45 million passengers annually.
text:
The Terminal-2 at Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) is all set to become operation from Sunday after Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu on Saturday inaugurated the renovated terminal.

T2, built by the Airports Authority of India (AAI) four decades ago, was shut for renovation in April. It has an annual capacity of 15 million passengers.

India could become one of the world’s largest civil aviation ecosystems, Naidu said at the inaugural function.

The entire transfer ecosystem should be made more efficient to make the airport an international hub, he said, adding that the airport could have an annual passenger handling capacity of around 130 million with efficient use of space.

The minister added that the Delhi airport was focusing on sustainability, including concentrating on the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF).

The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) in the Capital, also the country’s largest airport, has three terminals (T1, T2 and T3) and four runways. It handles more than 1,300 flight movements daily.

DIAL CEO Videh Kumar Jaipuriar said the airport had an annual passenger handling capacity of over 100 million.

Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL) operates IGIA.

On March 20, DIAL said the expanded T1 could accommodate 40 million passengers, and T3 could handle 45 million passengers annually.

title: American Airlines Debuts Airbus A321XLR With Luxury Flagship Suite Experience, Boosting ...
description:
American Airlines has become the first US airline to operate the Airbus A321XLR, introducing the aircraft as the new standard for long-range comfort, fuel efficiency, and premium passenger experience.
​ The aircraft’s launch signals a new chapter in cross-country air comfort, consolidating American’s leadership in the North American premium market.
Every A321XLR features custom-configured interiors built around the airline’s next-generation Flagship experience, already introduced on its new Boeing 787-9 aircraft earlier in 2025.
Fleet Expansion and Future Outlook American Airlines is set to receive up to fifty Airbus A321XLR aircraft through 2030, complementing its continued investment in widebody modernization and fleet sustainability.
Bridging performance, sustainability, and luxury design, the aircraft signals a shift toward premium single-aisle travel, uniting coast-to-coast business flyers and leisure travellers under one enhanced travel experience.
text:
American Airlines has become the first US airline to operate the Airbus A321XLR, introducing the aircraft as the new standard for long-range comfort, fuel efficiency, and premium passenger experience. The aircraft will make its commercial debut on December 18, 2025, operating under flight number AA3 from New York (JFK) to Los Angeles (LAX), marking a milestone in American’s ongoing fleet modernization. ​

Delivered from Airbus’ Hamburg facility on October 22, 2025, the new A321XLR joins American’s flagship fleet equipped with the exclusive three-cabin layout, offering a distinct blend of luxury, sustainability, and technology for transcontinental and eventual international services.

The Next Generation of Premium Travel

The A321XLR debuts with one hundred fifty-five total seats across three distinct cabins:

Twenty Flagship Suite seats – fully lie-flat with privacy doors, personal storage, wireless charging, and curated in-flight dining and beverage experiences.

Twelve Premium Economy recliners – designed for comfort with leg rests, adjustable headrests, extended recline, and premium amenities.

One Hundred Twenty-Three Main Cabin seats – offering new 4K seatback entertainment, Bluetooth connectivity, and USB-A/USB-C charging ports at every seat. ​

The aircraft’s launch signals a new chapter in cross-country air comfort, consolidating American’s leadership in the North American premium market. Every A321XLR features custom-configured interiors built around the airline’s next-generation Flagship experience, already introduced on its new Boeing 787-9 aircraft earlier in 2025.

Passengers in Flagship Suite will also gain access to the newly rebranded Greenwich Lounge at JFK Terminal 8, which merges American’s Flagship Lounge with British Airways’ premium facilities, offering exclusive dining and curated beverage selections. ​

Route Details: From US Coasts to Global Horizons

Initially, the A321XLR will focus on high-demand transcontinental routes between New York and Los Angeles, serving business and premium leisure travellers. Between December 19, 2025, and February 2026, the aircraft will operate multiple daily round trips on the route, complementing existing widebody Boeing 777 and 787 services. ​

The route schedule includes:

AA003 JFK – LAX (depart 11:00 a.m., arrive 2:18 p.m.)

AA004 LAX – JFK (depart 3:20 p.m., arrive 11:46 p.m.)

By mid-2026, the aircraft will extend its reach to international destinations, connecting New York, Philadelphia, and Boston with Western Europe. This expansion aligns with the A321XLR’s design mission to bridge mid-size markets with transatlantic range of forty seven hundred nautical miles, enabling nonstop flights to cities such as Dublin, Lisbon, and Manchester. ​

The aircraft’s efficiency allows American to serve smaller airports that cannot accommodate widebody aircraft, offering new opportunities for both business travellers and tourism-focused routes.

Sustainability and Efficiency at the Core

The Airbus A321XLR (Extra Long Range) represents one of the most environmentally advanced aircraft in the narrowbody category. Powered by next-generation CFM International LEAP-1A engines, it delivers up to thirty percent greater fuel efficiency and fifty percent lower noise footprint compared with older narrowbody models.

The aircraft’s reduced carbon emissions and extended range will support American Airlines’ broader sustainability strategy, which aims to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

As part of this initiative, American has signed sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) purchase agreements with Valero and Neste, marking its largest annual green fuel investments to date. The A321XLR therefore becomes central to the airline’s push toward sustainable, modern, and long-range operations. ​

Refining the Passenger Experience

The A321XLR debuts an enhanced travel environment with improved cabin pressurization and higher humidity levels, reducing passenger fatigue on extended flights. The cabin’s wide single-aisle configuration mirrors the spacious comfort of larger twin-aisle aircraft, redefining expectations for narrowbody travel.

Passengers in all cabins will experience the airline’s reimagined onboard service, including:

Flagship Dining menus, with multicourse options paired with award-winning wines curated by American’s culinary design team.

Lavazza premium coffee, further enhancing the consistent culinary partnerships introduced throughout 2025. ​

Upgraded entertainment systems, providing up to two hundred hours of movies, TV, and lifestyle programming in ultra-high definition.

These details elevate comfort while maintaining American’s commitment to inclusive design and onboard accessibility, ensuring all passengers, from business travellers to leisure seekers, experience a modern, connected journey.

Economic and Tourism Benefits

The arrival of the A321XLR comes at a crucial time for US tourism and aviation recovery, opening new route opportunities and boosting travel flexibility. The narrowbody’s transatlantic capabilities will expand passenger choices across smaller city markets at competitive fares, stimulating inbound tourism and business travel flow to and from the United States.

The aircraft’s combination of range and premium service also allows American to strengthen its hub network, especially at New York JFK and Philadelphia, both key East Coast gateways for transatlantic and Latin American travel. This development reinforces the carrier’s position as a leader in next-generation travel experiences while supporting US tourism infrastructure through expanded connectivity.

Industry analysts expect American’s A321XLR utilization to enhance visitor accessibility to secondary European tourism destinations, promoting regions such as the Iberian Peninsula, Ireland, and the Mediterranean as attractive options for both American and international travellers.

Fleet Expansion and Future Outlook

American Airlines is set to receive up to fifty Airbus A321XLR aircraft through 2030, complementing its continued investment in widebody modernization and fleet sustainability. The airline’s long-term fleet strategy includes harmonizing interiors across new deliveries, ensuring that customers encounter a consistent Flagship Suite experience across aircraft types. ​

This integration, together with orders for additional Boeing 787s and Embraer E175s, positions the airline to capture the premium passenger market across both international and domestic segments.

Looking ahead, American expects its A321XLR fleet to connect more than thirty global destinations within the next five years, blurring the lines between narrowbody comfort and long-haul luxury.

A New Standard for Air Travel

As the A321XLR prepares for its December 2025 inaugural service from New York to Los Angeles, it marks a transformative moment in American Airlines’ journey to redefine the future of mid‑range flying.

Bridging performance, sustainability, and luxury design, the aircraft signals a shift toward premium single-aisle travel, uniting coast-to-coast business flyers and leisure travellers under one enhanced travel experience.

By 2026, when the aircraft takes on international service, American will not only set new standards in US aviation excellence but also reaffirm its role as a trailblazer in next-generation global air travel.

title: SWISS Airbus A350 Enters Passenger Service with Inaugural Zurich–Palma Flight, Marking ...
description:
A new chapter in Swiss aviation began this weekend as SWISS International Air Lines (SWISS) officially introduced its first Airbus A350-900, registered HB-IFA “Lausanne,” into passenger service.
​ The event marks SWISS’s entry into the Airbus A350 era, replacing older A340-300 aircraft and emphasizing efficiency, luxury, and innovation.
​ Inside, SWISS Senses offers a four-class layout: Three First Class Suites featuring fully enclosed privacy spaces, sliding doors, and 32-inch entertainment screens.
At SWISS, the A350 is envisioned as the “flagbearer” of the company’s evolution toward responsible premium travel.
​ Looking Ahead: Expanding Horizons with Elegance SWISS’s Airbus A350 debut not only signifies a fleet expansion milestone but also a forward-looking investment in sustainability and passenger comfort.
text:
A new chapter in Swiss aviation began this weekend as SWISS International Air Lines (SWISS) officially introduced its first Airbus A350-900, registered HB-IFA “Lausanne,” into passenger service. The landmark inaugural flight LX2152 departed Zurich for Palma de Mallorca at 07:11 local time with two hundred thirty-three passengers on board, ushering in a new generation of sustainability and design for the airline’s long-haul fleet. ​

The event marks SWISS’s entry into the Airbus A350 era, replacing older A340-300 aircraft and emphasizing efficiency, luxury, and innovation. Over the next few weeks, the world’s newest A350 will serve shorter European routes including Prague, Hanover, Düsseldorf, Málaga, and Palma, allowing SWISS pilots to complete conversion training before the aircraft begins intercontinental service.

Introducing the SWISS Senses Cabin Concept

The new Airbus A350 is the first aircraft to introduce SWISS’s “Senses” long-haul cabin, an entirely redesigned onboard experience that draws inspiration from Switzerland’s landscapes, culture, and focus on passenger wellness. The new design concept combines cutting-edge materials, human-centric lighting systems, enhanced air quality, and signature scents to engage passengers’ five senses during the flight. ​

Inside, SWISS Senses offers a four-class layout:

Three First Class Suites featuring fully enclosed privacy spaces, sliding doors, and 32-inch entertainment screens.

Forty-Five Business Class seats with direct aisle access, personal storage, and a new “Suite Plus” option that can be paired for couples.

Thirty-Eight Premium Economy seats in a 2-3-2 layout with wider recline, ergonomic shells, and enhanced meal service.

One Hundred Fifty-Six Economy Class seats, each equipped with 13.3-inch 4K screens and Bluetooth connectivity for personal headphones. ​

This next-generation cabin emphasizes Swiss design values, functionality, minimalism, and comfort, while the calm color palette reflects the country’s alpine elegance. The Airbus A350’s lighting system mimics natural daylight to help reduce jet lag, while higher cabin humidity and lower pressurization levels enhance well-being during long-haul journeys.

A Sustainable Step Forward

The Airbus A350-900 is renowned for its environmental performance, consuming twenty-five percent less fueland emitting twenty-five percent fewer CO₂ emissions than previous-generation aircraft. It also produces fifty percent less noise, aligning with SWISS’s and parent company Lufthansa Group’s goals to reduce fleet emissions and noise pollution. ​

Built primarily from carbon-fiber composites, the plane operates with Rolls-Royce Trent XWB engines, among the most efficient in commercial aviation. The technological innovation supports SWISS’s broader sustainability initiatives, including investments in Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) and long-term fleet renewal programs.

The first A350, “HB-IFA Lausanne,” showcases Switzerland through an eye-catching special livery named “SWISS Wanderlust.” Created by artist Frédéric Siegel, the artwork celebrates Swiss heritage and natural beauty with artistic depictions of Bern, Geneva, and the Matterhorn, turning the aircraft into a “flying cultural ambassador”. ​

From Training Flights to Transatlantic Service

While currently assigned to short-haul European operations, SWISS’s A350 will enter long-haul service on November 20, 2025, with its first scheduled intercontinental route from Zurich to Boston. The twin-engine widebody will later expand to destinations across North America and Asia, including New York JFK, Tokyo Haneda, and Hong Kong, as part of the carrier’s gradual transition away from the four-engine A340 series.

By 2031, SWISS plans to receive nine additional Airbus A350s, standardizing its long-haul operations on newer, more eco-efficient aircraft types. This long-term project represents one of the airline’s largest modernization initiatives in decades, contributing to Lufthansa Group’s position among the most fuel-efficient airline networks in Europe. ​

Empowering Swiss Tourism and Traveler Appeal

The entry of the A350 fleet brings not only technological benefits but also a boost to business and leisure tourism to and from Switzerland. Improved efficiency and cabin comfort are expected to attract more travelers seeking premium flight experiences to Zurich, one of Europe’s leading hubs for connecting flights across the Alps, Mediterranean, and Asia-Pacific region.

The A350 enhances connectivity from Switzerland’s capital region and major tourism centers, including Lucerne, Interlaken, and Zurich, to key destinations worldwide. With improved passenger experience and operational reliability, this upgrade supports Switzerland’s tourism and trade sectors, reinforcing Zurich Airport’s ambition to rank among Europe’s most modern hubs.

In Palma de Mallorca, the A350’s inaugural landing also held symbolic meaning: Mallorca remains a leading leisure route for Swiss travelers seeking Mediterranean getaways. The debut highlights the aircraft’s versatility, balancing short-haul tourism traffic and long-haul premium travel.

Next Chapter: Fleet Synergy

The debut of the A350 complements parallel developments across the Lufthansa Group, including A350 integration at Lufthansa’s Munich hub and eco-design upgrades at Austrian Airlines. The rollout symbolizes a unified commitment to modern, sustainable aviation that combines environmental responsibility with luxury service.

At SWISS, the A350 is envisioned as the “flagbearer” of the company’s evolution toward responsible premium travel. CEO Jens Fehlinger described the milestone as a once-in-a-lifetime event for the airline, citing the precision, design, and teamwork that went into creating this next-generation flagship. ​

Looking Ahead: Expanding Horizons with Elegance

SWISS’s Airbus A350 debut not only signifies a fleet expansion milestone but also a forward-looking investment in sustainability and passenger comfort. Its combination of efficiency and indulgence underscores Switzerland’s position as both a global business hub and a luxury tourism destination.

As the A350 transitions to intercontinental service in November, travelers departing from Zurich can expect a new era of aviation style that blends Swiss precision with eco‑conscious engineering. With its “Senses” cabin and “Wanderlust” design, the A350 transforms every journey into a sensory experience, setting a new benchmark for European air travel excellence.

title: Japan's Cosmo Oil Starts Construction of Sustainable Aviation Fuel Unit - Industrial Info
description:
Last year, Japan announced its airlines would replace 10% of all aviation fuel with biojet fuel by 2030.
Cosmo Oil Company Limited (Tokyo, Japan) has started construction of a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) unit which will become operational in 2025.
Taiyo Oil Company Limited (Tokyo) has decided to construct a SAF unit with ethanol as the feed as well as another SAF unit which will use carbon monoxide and woody biomass for the feed.

title: Singapore to Impose Green Aviation Fuel Levy Singapore's parliament has passed ... - Facebook
description:
Singapore to Impose Green Aviation Fuel Levy Singapore's parliament has passed legislation allowing the Civil Aviation Authority to impose a green aviation fuel levy on departing flights.
The funds will support sustainable aviation fuel procurement and infrastructure development at Changi Airport.
Pyka Plans Hybrid-Electric DropShip Cargo Drone Pyka announced plans to develop the DropShip, a hybrid-electric uncrewed aerial vehicle, and rebrand its all-electric Pelican cargo drone as the first generation of the DropShip.
ShippingWatch Reports on Key Port Development ShippingWatch reports on major development projects in the global port sector.
Ocean Rates Flat Amid China Port Fee Adjustments Ocean freight rates from China to the U.S. have remained flat as carriers adjust to new port fees.
text:
Singapore to Impose Green Aviation Fuel Levy

Singapore's parliament has passed legislation allowing the Civil Aviation Authority to impose a green aviation fuel levy on departing flights. The funds will support sustainable aviation fuel procurement and infrastructure development at Changi Airport.

Pyka Plans Hybrid-Electric DropShip Cargo Drone

Pyka announced plans to develop the DropShip, a hybrid-electric uncrewed aerial vehicle, and rebrand its all-electric Pelican cargo drone as the first generation of the DropShip.

DHL Targets Sub-Saharan Africa with $300M Investment

DHL Express is investing $300 million to expand its logistics network across Sub-Saharan Africa. This initiative aims to enhance connectivity and support regional economic growth by improving supply chain infrastructure.

ShippingWatch Reports on Key Port Development

ShippingWatch reports on major development projects in the global port sector. The focus is on growth and transformation strategies of various ports, highlighting upcoming innovations and infrastructure investments to enhance shipping efficiency and competitiveness in a rapidly evolving logistics landscape.

Trump Plans 100% Tariffs on China Starting Nov. 1

President Trump announced new 100% tariffs on Chinese imports, effective November 1, in response to China's export controls on rare earths and critical materials.

Ocean Rates Flat Amid China Port Fee Adjustments

Ocean freight rates from China to the U.S. have remained flat as carriers adjust to new port fees. The adjustments aim to balance cost pressures and maintain service levels amid fluctuating demand and regulatory changes.

DP World Partners with Tashkent Invest on Logistics Hub

DP World has entered a joint venture with Tashkent Invest, a subsidiary of the Tashkent City Administration, to develop and operate a cutting-edge multimodal logistics terminal near Uzbekistan’s capital.

dnata and Trade Tech Collaborate on UAE MPCI Compliance

dnata logistics and Trade Tech have partnered to assist UAE freight forwarders in meeting the new Maritime Preload Cargo Information (MPCI) regulations. The collaboration aims to streamline compliance with the 24-hour cargo data submission requirement.

MarketBeat keeps track of Wall Street's top-rated and best performing research analysts and the stocks they recommend to their clients on a daily basis. MarketBeat has identified the five stocks that top analysts are quietly whispering to their clients to buy now before the broader market catches on... and Neste OYJ wasn't on the list.

While Neste OYJ currently has a Hold rating among analysts, top-rated analysts believe these five stocks are better buys.

title: This week, I met with the ADS team to hear more about the aerospace sector's outlook in the UK.
description:
17 likes, 0 comments - aphrabrandreth on October 25, 2025: "This week, I met with the ADS team to hear more about the aerospace sector’s outlook in the UK.

ADS is the UK trade association for the aerospace, defence, security and space industries.

Here in the North West, the aerospace industry directly supports over 16,000 jobs. It’s vital we continue to back this world-leading sector, supporting innovation, skills and jobs for the future.

We also spoke about SAF (Sustainable Aviation Fuel). It’s an alternative to conventional jet fuel made from renewable or waste sources, designed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Particularly timely after a debate on the topic in Parliament just last week.".

outlet: Plug Power Shares Ignite on Leadership Shift and Strategic Moves
title: Plug Power Shares Ignite on Leadership Shift and Strategic Moves - AD HOC NEWS
description:
Plug Power shares experienced an extraordinary trading session on Friday, skyrocketing 177% to close at $2.93.
This dramatic surge reflects growing market confidence in the hydrogen company's strategic repositioning and recent corporate developments that have captured analyst attention.
Concurrently, the stock's fair value assessment climbed from $2.42 to $2.78, indicating growing optimism among market researchers.
Strategic Leadership Transition A pivotal factor behind the share price explosion centers on a significant leadership announcement.
Market experts view this promotion as a strategic move aimed at enhancing operational excellence and financial discipline.
text:
Plug Power shares experienced an extraordinary trading session on Friday, skyrocketing 177% to close at $2.93. This dramatic surge reflects growing market confidence in the hydrogen company's strategic repositioning and recent corporate developments that have captured analyst attention.

The investment case for Plug Power received significant validation from financial institutions, with HSBC substantially raising its price target from $2.50 to $4.40. The banking firm cited the beginning of a new cycle in the U.S. cleantech sector, supported by declining interest rates, more sustainable growth assumptions, and increasingly rational government policy. Concurrently, the stock's fair value assessment climbed from $2.42 to $2.78, indicating growing optimism among market researchers.

Further positive sentiment emerged from HC Wainwright, which revised its loss-per-share projections to less negative territory. Investors are now looking toward the upcoming third-quarter report scheduled for November 11 for additional confirmation of this improving trend.

Strategic Leadership Transition

A pivotal factor behind the share price explosion centers on a significant leadership announcement. The company revealed that Jose Luis Crespo will assume the CEO position in March 2026 following the filing of the 2025 annual report. Current chief executive Andy Marsh will transition to a role on the supervisory board, ensuring continuity during a critical period for the hydrogen economy.

Should investors sell immediately? Or is it worth buying Plug Power?

Crespo brings substantial credentials to the position, having managed a global sales pipeline exceeding $8 billion as Chief Revenue Officer while maintaining key relationships with industry giants including Amazon, Walmart, and Home Depot. Market experts view this promotion as a strategic move aimed at enhancing operational excellence and financial discipline.

Expanding Partnerships Drive Growth Prospects

Complementing the leadership news, a series of strategic partnerships has generated additional momentum. The most recent highlight involves collaboration with Edgewood Renewables to develop an advanced sustainable fuel production facility in Las Vegas. This project will focus on converting waste biomass into sustainable aviation fuel, renewable diesel, and biomethanol.

Operational achievements further demonstrate the company's expanding market presence. Successful installation of hydrogen fuel cell systems at the Floor & Decor logistics center in Washington showcases practical implementation, while timely hydrogen deliveries to Europe's H2CAST project evidence the scalability of Plug Power's production capabilities across international markets.

title: Delhi airport emerging as preferred transfer hub, says Naidu; T2 to be operational on Sun
authors: NewsDrum Desk, NewsDrum Desk Updated On
description:
The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) can handle more than 100 million passengers annually.
Together, Air India and IndiGo will operate around 120 daily domestic flights from the upgraded T2, DIAL said in a release.
Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), a consortium led by the GMR Group, operates the IGIA, which is also the country's largest airport.
The minister also said the Delhi airport is focusing on sustainability, including concentrating on the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF).
The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) in the national capital, also the country's largest airport, has three terminals -- T1, T2, and T3 -- and four runways.
text:
New Delhi: Delhi airport's refurbished Terminal 2 will be operational from October 26, enhancing passenger handling capacity at the country's largest airport, with Air India and IndiGo set to operate a total of 120 flights daily.

Inaugurating the revamped T2, Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu on Saturday said the government is developing and transforming airports into world-class transit hubs at an unprecedented pace.

"Handling nearly 50 per cent of the Northern region's total passenger traffic and managing nearly 50,000 transfers every day, Delhi is emerging as a preferred transfer hub," he said.

The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) can handle more than 100 million passengers annually.

The more than 40-year-old T2 was shut for renovation works in April this year and will become operational on the intervening night of October 25-26, coinciding with the start of the winter schedule, during which the airport is set to have around 13 per cent more flights than the previous winter schedule.

The winter schedule is from October 26, 2025, to March 28, 2026.

Together, Air India and IndiGo will operate around 120 daily domestic flights from the upgraded T2, DIAL said in a release.

"This (T2) reopening also allows for more balanced airline operations across terminals, further enhancing efficiency and convenience for millions of travellers," DIAL CEO Videh Kumar Jaipuriar said.

Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), a consortium led by the GMR Group, operates the IGIA, which is also the country's largest airport.

At the inaugural, Naidu said India can become one of the world's largest civil aviation ecosystems.

The whole transfer ecosystem should be made more efficient for making the airport an international hub, he said and added that the airport can have an annual passenger handling capacity of around 130 million with efficient use of space.

The minister also said the Delhi airport is focusing on sustainability, including concentrating on the use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF).

According to DIAL, the future-ready T2 will play a pivotal role in strengthening the airport's position as India's foremost aviation hub, equipped to handle the next phase of passenger growth efficiently and sustainably.

The revamped T2 will feature a Self Baggage Drop (SBD) facility, enabling passengers to check in bags independently and reducing queues and waiting time.

Among others, there will be six new Passenger Boarding Bridges (PBBs).

In terms of infrastructure and safety, T2 has undergone comprehensive mechanical and electrical upgrades, and the refurbished airside and apron areas are designed to support efficient aircraft movement and accommodate future traffic growth, DIAL said.

At the T2, the first arriving flight will be IndiGo's 6E 2058 from Lucknow at around 0025 hours on October 26, while the first departing flight will be IndiGo's 6E 2343 to Pune at 0215 hours on October 26.

The Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) in the national capital, also the country's largest airport, has three terminals -- T1, T2, and T3 -- and four runways. It handles more than 1,300 flight movements daily.

title: United Airlines & Neste Expand Partnership, Bringing SAF To 3 Additional Hubs
description:
The partnership represents the first time that any airline has operated to the three hubs, flying on SAF.
United & Neste: Growing Together Neste has been supplying SAF to United at O’Hare since August 2024 and provided the alternative fuel to UA’s fleet at SFO over the past as well.
The airline burned 4,300 metric tons (13 million gallons) of SAF last year, when only two major hubs were using the alternative fuel.
As small as 13 million gallons may be by comparison, it is still a huge leap forward in progress compared to previous years.
Neste’s global SAF production capability is 1.5 million tons (515 million gallons) per year, and the company projects it will grow to 2.2 million tons (750 million gallons) by the end of 2027.
text:
In the Summer of 2025, United Airlines (UA) and Neste brought sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) to these three airports for the first time: Houston George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH) in Houston, Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR) in New Jersey, and Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD) in Washington, DC. The partnership represents the first time that any airline has operated to the three hubs, flying on SAF.

The new locations build on the successful SAF operations at Chicago O’Hare International Airport (ORD) and San Francisco International Airport (SFO) where Neste has been supplying UA since last year. The term of the SAF contract at IAH is until the end of this month, while EWR and IAD are scheduled for SAF flights until next year.

United & Neste: Growing Together

Neste has been supplying SAF to United at O’Hare since August 2024 and provided the alternative fuel to UA’s fleet at SFO over the past as well. At SFO, the California state government’s Low Carbon Fuel Standard (LCFS) is supporting the use of renewable fuels, which both incentivizes carriers and helps offset development costs for suppliers.

United has been happy with the results and takes the top spot for SAF operators in America. The airline burned 4,300 metric tons (13 million gallons) of SAF last year, when only two major hubs were using the alternative fuel. The contribution of major carriers like UA toward emissions reduction is key to lowering the 2-3% of greenhouse gases that air transport accounts for worldwide.

The global commercial aviation industry uses about 4.3 billion gallons of fuel per year, according to the World Economic Forum. As small as 13 million gallons may be by comparison, it is still a huge leap forward in progress compared to previous years. United Chief Sustainability Officer, Lauren Riley, was quoted in a Neste press release regarding the expanded SAF supply agreement:

“United remains the leading SAF user in the US… we recognize that the growth of the SAF market requires support from both state and federal governments.”

Cleaning Skies By Burning Trash

Neste’s MY Sustainable Aviation Fuel is blended with conventional jet fuel before use and is currently certified for use at up to a 50% ratio. Neste uses 100% renewable raw materials to make its SAF product, including used cooking oil and animal fat waste. The alternative jet fuel has been shown to reduce carbon emissions by as much as 80%, when used unblended. The cost is much higher than conventional jet fuel, which is why government incentives are key to increasing adoption.

Currently, SAF can cost anywhere from 2–5 times the price of conventional jet fuel. Despite that high price tag, United has been saying since at least 2021 that it is pursuing emissions reduction of 100% by 2050. The airline has publicly stated on numerous occasions that it believes SAF is a better option for the environment than buying offsets, which are “emissions credits,” and it believes that the industry would have a strong appetite for the product if made readily available.

Neste Is Ramping Up

United’s “Good Leads The Way” brand campaign specifically focuses on promoting SAF use as part of a drive to do the right thing for customers, employees, communities and the planet. The low global supply is a significant roadblock to widespread adoption, and partnerships like UA and Neste are helping to bring down prices and increase supply through joint development.

Neste’s global SAF production capability is 1.5 million tons (515 million gallons) per year, and the company projects it will grow to 2.2 million tons (750 million gallons) by the end of 2027. Using waste is the ideal source of raw material to create SAF, but it is also in demand by other industry sectors.

On top of the existing financial barrier, should it be necessary to generate the base material for SAF refinement, costs will go up again. United is pushing to raise the visibility of how beneficial SAF is in the near and long-term goal of reducing aviation emissions, with the goal of encouraging the government and wider industry to help facilitate faster mass production and widespread SAF usage.

title: Ethiopia advances energy and transport strategy with major project - BioEnergy Times
description:
The biorefinery aims to supply SAF for aviation with a 10 percent blend target, meeting a projected demand of 530,000 million litres annually between 2028 and 2030.
Additionally, transport ethanol blends (E10–E20) are expected to reach 115–230 million litres annually within the same timeframe.
Richard Bennett, founder and CEO of Sunbird Bioenergy Africa, said Ethiopia’s biofuel policy has laid a strong foundation for such projects.
Tewodros Getachew, CEO of the Ethiopian Mining Corporation, told Birrmetrics that the biorefinery will produce 40–60 million litres annually.
Simultaneously, the government is expanding LNG production via the Ogaden project, which generates more than 100 million litres of LNG annually for industrial use.
text:
Ethiopia is moving forward with its energy and transportation transformation through a new 23,000-hectare agricultural biorefinery, developed in partnership between Sunbird Bioenergy Africa and the Ethiopian Mining Corporation (EMC), reported Birr Metrics.

Set to begin operations by 2030, the project will produce Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF), household biofuels, and ethanol for transportation, supporting Ethiopia’s broader transition to electric vehicles (EVs), liquefied natural gas (LNG), and compressed natural gas (CNG).

The biorefinery aims to supply SAF for aviation with a 10 percent blend target, meeting a projected demand of 530,000 million litres annually between 2028 and 2030. It will also produce 120–150 million litres of clean household cooking fuel yearly from 2025 to 2030, replacing kerosene, charcoal, and LPG. Additionally, transport ethanol blends (E10–E20) are expected to reach 115–230 million litres annually within the same timeframe.

Using locally sourced feedstocks such as cassava and sugarcane, the project is designed to boost rural employment and agricultural development. Under the partnership, Sunbird Bioenergy will oversee renewable fuel production, while EMC will contribute industrial expertise, infrastructure, and logistics support.

Richard Bennett, founder and CEO of Sunbird Bioenergy Africa, said Ethiopia’s biofuel policy has laid a strong foundation for such projects. He noted that the World Bank is exploring financing models to help ensure the project’s success, adding that Sunbird’s goal is to replace a substantial share of Ethiopia’s fossil fuel consumption with biofuels.

Tewodros Getachew, CEO of the Ethiopian Mining Corporation, told Birrmetrics that the biorefinery will produce 40–60 million litres annually. He confirmed that EMC and Sunbird are partnering to supply jet fuel for Ethiopian Airlines, with EMC managing distribution and serving as the main point of contact. The facility is expected to be operational within five years.

Ethiopia’s energy transition is already progressing, with policies encouraging EV adoption through import incentives. The country now has over 115,000 registered electric vehicles. Simultaneously, the government is expanding LNG production via the Ogaden project, which generates more than 100 million litres of LNG annually for industrial use. Plans are also underway to promote CNG for buses and private vehicles, with a target of one million CNG-powered vehicles by 2027.
